Articles.Content: I have had next to no problems landing the S25 on the runway, and when I have had an issue its been minor.

I have had next to no problems landing the S25 on the runway, and when I have had an issue its been minor.

My minor issues usually involve losing wings during the approach.

Haha, if you try what I did in this post, separate the Mun doors, and you don't mind loading an additional 18 textures for the Super25, you can do this:

Just be prepared to melt your computer.

Edited July 13, 2014 by qnistNAMEERF

My minor issues usually involve losing wings during the approach.

Did you try looking behind the sofa cushions?

Did you try looking behind the sofa cushions?

I'll get right to that, just the little matter of spinning out of control to worry about first.
Loosing a wing on approach sounds like pilot error.

Loosing a wing on approach sounds like pilot error.

not at all. it's just like losing your car keys or your wallet. haven't you ever lost anything before?
i don't want everyone phase cause or i need to turn down my graphics all i want is phase one can you give me a download ?

can i just have phase one?

can i just have phase one?
whoops didn't mean to do that

Loosing a wing on approach sounds like pilot error.

It's really easy to lose wings with the KSO using FAR from the discussions we've had on this thread.
Really looking forward to those little service vehicles.

i don't want everyone phase cause or i need to turn down my graphics all i want is phase one can you give me a download ?

For now, there's a script (windows only) that'll install separate phases included in the zip. Some have had trouble with it, though. If you check out the link in my signature you can find a list of phase1 parts and also separate it yourself if you like.

I figured some around here might find this useful...

Thank YOU my good sir!
It kinda peeves me how whenever it gets below 100 m/s if you do any maneuvering that doesn't involve going up the aircraft picks up speed, gotta love ksp physics!
Thank you! I will try this out. I cant imagine KSP w/o FAR.

It kinda peeves me how whenever it gets below 100 m/s if you do any maneuvering that doesn't involve going up the aircraft picks up speed, gotta love ksp physics!

Yeah it's a crummy balancing act.

If I lower the lift values by just a few decimals, the orbiter will want to just drop like a rock. It's where it is now to allow some leeway and margin of error for folks that don't come in perfectly right. The way I figure; folks that want "realistic" flying characteristics will more than likely have FAR and DRE going, which uses its own numbers pretty much. The rest of us on the other hand that'd rather it be easier with some forgiveness are fine with the ballooning effect that sometimes occurs.

The 74th of my STS KSO Shuttle Missions! STS 174 is the fourth flight of the Super 25! Ascension files again wearing the Limited Edition Corporate Livery Paint Scheme! STS 174's objective is to deploy the Colony Docking Module on Asteroid Kerpophis. Due to corporate sponsorship, the Loyalists have changed their name to the Corporatists! No comment from the Rebels on this new, more profitable name.

STS 175 will deploy the Kerpophis Colony Tug & Airlock Module!
Helldiver: You may have missed this, but what's the deal with RPM 0.17? I tried the KSO (original) with RPM 0.17 installed, and the screens don't work.

Helldiver: You may have missed this, but what's the deal with RPM 0.17? I tried the KSO (original) with RPM 0.17 installed, and the screens don't work.

RPM 0.17 has breaking changes, hence why it says, "Breaking changes

Do NOT hurry to install this one." on the OP of the RPM thread.
Yeah, but Helldiver said KSO should work with the latest RPM.
The Super 25 works fine with RPM 0.17, haven't tried the standard KSO yet.

Yeah, but Helldiver said KSO should work with the latest RPM.

Sounds like it doesn't work from what you're saying. So just stick with the copy of RPM provided in KSOS if you want to use RPM with KSOS. I'm sure they'll update it to support RPM 0.17 when they get the chance.

Good thing that we all still have the 307LE zip file with the livery in it.
